cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the north-central Gulf toward southeast Louisiana, then turning north and northeast inland over Louisiana and Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon – Grand Isle area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Louisiana – all upgraded to warnings
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Louisiana and Mississippi coastline, especially areas east of the landfall point
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) likely, with gusts well above 100 mph possible in and near the port corridor Sunday afternoon through early Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 8–12 ft possible near the Mississippi River delta; several feet of water can push upriver toward industrial docks along the Lower Mississippi
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–18 in with isolated pockets up to 24 in, producing serious freshwater and urban flooding along the port complex
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents; prolonged power outages and navigation channel debris expected
